column4: my wireless pcmcia card says "NOT READY!" under iwconfig, any ideas? (new ubuntu-server install)
what kind of wifi card?
what chipset does it have?  try lspcmcia or lspci to see if you can get any more info.
well what chipset is it?
prism chipset yeah.  hrm...
hold on let me check something.
thx, will do :)
if its anything but v1 you are going to have problems with it.
does it say "made in china"  or a version on the pcmcia card?
yeah its a problem with that version but you can still get it working here's a howto http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=76804
what did you do since then?
upgrade your kernel or something?
formatted and installed ubuntu-server
well is it possible that you installed ndiswrapper before to get it working?
probably, but its hard to install it without an internet connection :(
is it possible to install it from the ubuntu cd (server or normal)?

depends on what you consider hard.  I'm sure there are howto's ont he forums.  You probably could use the install cd to install it.  ndiswrapper should be on there.  You would just have to get a way to get the windows driver over.
i have the windows driver cd.. that might help :P
if its the corerct windows driver yes.
eject
err.  sudo eject
would i want the win xp driver for my pcmcia card?
thanks for you help, dont let the bed bugs bite :)
